intro: Columbia jagorii, commonly known as the Columbia jagorii, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Columbia jagorii is considered a vulnerable species.
